results.headline: Wattstax (Movie)

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Wattstax

results.summary_short: Mel Stuart's documentary is about a 1973 concert in Watts that commemorated the 1965 Los Angeles riots. The film is a mix of performances (including an Isaac Hayes number that wasn't in the original release), interviews, rap sessions (before rap's meaning changed) and comedy (Richard Pryor). Larry Clark (who became known as a photographer of young people and as the director of  "Kids") was one of the four cinematographers. — Anita Gates
